result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Lee Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:03 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Jesse Lee Leichsenring in court for Christopher Lee Martinez.  Attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Both counsel received the PSI and have no corrections.  State makes recommendation of a total of 14 years initial confinement.  State makes argument.  Atty Leichsenring makes recommendation of a total of 7 years initial confinement, consecutive to each other.  DE makes a statement.  Recess at 3:40 PM to allow Court to take matter under advisement.  Back on the record at 4:15 PM.  Back on the record at Court imposes sentence.

Count 2:

WI State Prison for 3 years (1 year Initial Confinement/2 years Extended Supervision), concurrent to Count 3 and consecutive to all others
7 days jail credit
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Submit to DNA sample

CONDITIONS OF ES:  

AODA/follow-up
Absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx
Random UA's per agent
Seek/maintain full-time employment
Any other conditions per agent
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Count 3:

WI State Prison for 3 years (1 year Initial Confinement/2 years Extended Supervision), concurrent to Count 2 and consecutive to all others
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Submit to DNA sample

CONDITIONS OF ES:  

AODA/follow-up
Absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx
Random UA's per agent
Seek/maintain full-time employment
Any other conditions per agent
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Leichsenring received and waives reading of Information.  DE advised of charges and penalties.
Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2

3:29 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Jesse Lee Leichsenring in court for Christopher Lee Martinez.  Attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for State of Wisconsin.  States moves to dismiss but read in Counts 1 and 4-10.  NCP entered on Cts. 2 & 3, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. finds Def. guilty.  PSI to be ordered and sentencing set out.  State agrees to cap the initial confinement at 14 years initial confinement.  Court revokes bond and DE is remanded to the jail pending sentencing.
Plea hearing on June 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Jesse Lee Leichsenring and Atty Allison Markoski in court for Christopher Lee Martinez.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes matter is set for a plea hearing today.  Atty Markoski is moving to withdraw on 22CF128 and 22CF214 and 22CF237 at the DE's request and new counsel would be appointed by the PD's office.  DE is in agreement.  Court questions DE on his understanding and notes those 3 matters are/will be set for PH in August.  Court will allow Atty Markoski to withdraw in those 3 cases and new counsel to be appointed.  22CF214 will be added for a PH on 8/18/22 at 9:30 a.m. to track with 22CF128 and 22CF237.  Court questions Atty Leichsenring on status of his cases noting 22CF39 still needs a PH.  Atty Leichsenring notes he will be filing a motion to withdraw as well noting one of the cases is set for trial in 9 days.  Court notes that's a Br 1 case.  Court explains why all matters were set in her Branch as she has the oldest felony but notes each branch has some of these cases.  State notes all 22CF cases still need a PH so asks that all those be kicked back to the right branch for PH.  21CF130 is set for a JT in Br 1 in 9 days.  State notes there may also be some more criminal charges coming down the pipe.  Court will focus on the Br 2 matters only - 22CF39.  Court will have that matter set for PH but unsure about when to set it for.  State would agree to have all 4 matters set for PH at the same date/time - 8/18/2022.  Court orders PH set in 22CF39 at 9:30 and blocks off 9:45 also.  Court won't take any action on the motions to withdraw as each branch will need to address those as well as scheduling on an individual basis.  Atty Markoski notes she has filed a motion to modify bond but the Court won't hear it as she's been allowed to withdraw.  That motion can be addressed once new counsel is appointed.  State agrees.
Plea hearing on June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.

02:03 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court with attorney Jesse Lee Leichsenring.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Leichsenring advises there is a global offer.  Requests a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Absolute Sobriety.   Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. May not reside in any location that is anywhere within 1000 feeet of a park or school
Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorneys

Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on February 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:22 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Kathryn E Hayes by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for public defender representation.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends cash bond.  Atty Hayes recommends no more than $100 cash bond.  $5,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety.  No possession of alcohol.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  May not reside in any location that is anywhere within 1,000 feet of a park or a school.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
